text: What's up?  I'm Marko.  I'm Alex, and we're the Vagabrothers.
As you might know, we've been traveling the world

of videos, highlighting the top 10 things
to do in our favorite places around the world,
starting with our home town,
San Diego, California.
Number 1:  beaches.  San Diego has
over 100 kilometers of coastline,
everything from the boardwalk of Pacific Beach
to the classic surf breaks of La Jolla or the
more down-low spots in Sunset Cliffs.
San Diego's only 15 minutes from Mexico,
which means that we've got the best
Mexican food in the whole country.
But, we can't agree on who serves up the best burrito.
I vote for Cuatro Milpas
Dude.  No Way!  El Cuervo.  See what I mean?
Number 3:  Craft Beer
San Diego is quickly becoming the craft
beer capital of the U.S. with dozens of
breweries, cranking out some badasss (?)
beer that's changing the American  brew scene
for the hoppier.  Number 4:
Old Town.  Old Town is the original
Spanish settlement of San Diego. Now,
it's pretty touristic, but it's a good place
to get a dose of local history and a great place
for a strong Margherita.  From there,
head up the coast to Torrey Pines State Park,
a gorgeous stretch of cliffs and coasts
that's the best place to see unspoiled San Diego.
Number 6:  San Diego Harbor.
San Diego is a city of sails
and home to the U.S. Navy Pacific Fleet.
Take it in with a sunset cruise.
For dinner, head to Hillcrest, home to San Diego's
LGBT community and
some of the best ethnic restaurants
in town.  For Ethiopian cuisine
to Afgan.  For drinks, head up Washington
Street to North Park, the hipster hangout
of San Diego, complete with cafes,
book shops, and some of the best bars in the city.
Number 9:  Petco Park in downtown.
Watching a baseball game in San Diego's
new ball park is a must.
It's built between old brick warehouses and
its construction completely revitalised
downtown.  Win or lose, post game
drinks in the nearby Gaslamp District
is a guaranteed home-run.
Finally, explore the rest of San Diego County.
It's one of the largest in the country with plenty to see:
from the beach towns to the north, to the
outdoor opportunities of the east.
And of course, you can always visit Tijuana.
